entries.heading: Golden and Silver Rules
entries.text: Golden and Silver Rules

entries.heading: Golden Rule
entries.text: Card text supersedes rules text. Whenever a card fundamentally contradicts the rules, the card's indication is what is true.

entries.heading: Silver Rule
entries.text: Card text uses different terminology than rules. Card text should be interpreted according to these rules, not as though it were text within these rules.

entries.heading: Card means Main Deck card
entries.text: Card, when written in card effects, is shorthand for "Main Deck card." Runes, legends, and battlefields are not considered cards when executing the abilities and effects of game objects. They are considered cards for the purposes of these rules.

entries.heading: Cards refer to themselves in the first person
path: Cards refer to themselves in the first person
entries.text: Cards refer to themselves in the first person.

entries.heading: Units and legends use “I/me”
path: Cards refer to themselves in the first person
entries.text: Units and legends say "I," "me," etc.

entries.heading: Gear and spells use “this”
path: Cards refer to themselves in the first person
entries.text: Gear and spells say "this."

entries.heading: Battlefields use “here”
path: Cards refer to themselves in the first person
entries.text: Battlefields say "here."

entries.heading: “Can’t beats Can”
entries.text: “Can’t beats Can”

entries.heading: Forbid supersedes allow
entries.text: Cards that forbid actions or effects, as a broad method of determination, supersede cards that allow or permit that same action or effect.

entries.heading: Do as much as you can
path: Do as much as you can
entries.text: When executing card text, do as much as you can, ignoring impossible instructions.

entries.heading: If all instructions are impossible
path: Do as much as you can
entries.text: If all of a card’s instructions are impossible, it is still played and resolved, but nothing happens.

entries.heading: Riftbound is a Trading Card Game
path: Riftbound is a Trading Card Game
entries.text: Riftbound is a Trading Card Game where a player must provide their own cards to play against other players.

entries.heading: What you need to play
entries.text: To play Riftbound, a player must have two Decks, a Champion Legend, and a number of Battlefields determined by the Mode of Play.

entries.heading: 1 Champion Legend
entries.text: 1 Champion Legend

entries.heading: Placed in the Legend Zone at start
path: Placed in the Legend Zone at start
entries.text: This is placed in the Legend Zone at the start of the game.

entries.heading: Dictates Domain Identity
entries.text: This will dictate the Domain Identity of the Main Deck.

entries.heading: Cards must abide Domain Identity
entries.text: Cards included in your Deck must abide by your Domain Identity.

entries.heading: Domain Identity dictated by domains of Champion Legend
path: Domain Identity dictated by domains of Champion Legend
entries.text: Your deck’s Domain Identity is dictated by the domains of your Champion Legend. In the default card frame, these domains appear as symbols in the legend’s upper left corner.

entries.heading: Single Domain permitted in corresponding identity
path: Single Domain permitted in corresponding identity
entries.text: If a card has a single Domain, then that card is permitted in the Domain Identity that corresponds to the same Domain.

entries.heading: Multi-Domain permitted only if identity contains all domains
path: Multi-Domain permitted only if identity contains all domains
entries.text: If a card has more than one Domain, then that card is permitted only in a Domain Identity that contains all of the indicated Domains on that card.

entries.heading: Main Deck (at least 40 cards)
entries.text: A Main Deck of at least 40 cards 1 Chosen Champion Unit Units Gear Spells

entries.heading: Chosen Champion
entries.text: Chosen Champion

entries.heading: Placed in Champion Zone at start
path: Placed in Champion Zone at start
entries.text: This will be placed in the Champion Zone at the start of the game.

entries.heading: Must match Champion Legend tag
entries.text: Must be a champion unit with a champion tag that matches the tag on your Champion Legend. Example: Loose Cannon has the tag Jinx. Therefore, a player could choose Jinx, Rebel or Jinx, Demolitionist as their Chosen Champion, because they also have the tag Jinx. Example: Tibbers has the tag Annie, but it is a signature unit, not a champion unit. It cannot be your Chosen Champion, even if your Champion Legend has the tag Annie.

entries.heading: Chosen Champion identity during gameplay
entries.text: A player’s Chosen Champion is both the specific card chosen for this slot during Deck Building and also any Champion Unit with the same name as the specific card selected for this specific slot during the course of play. Example: A player chose Jinx, Rebel as their Chosen Champion. One copy of Jinx, Rebel starts the game in their Chosen Champion zone. Any additional copies of Jinx, Rebel in their Main Deck, their hand, their trash, or on the board also count as their Chosen Champion for any game rules and effects that care about Chosen Champion status during the game.

entries.heading: Up to 3 copies of same named card
path: Up to 3 copies of same named card
entries.text: Your Main Deck can include up to 3 copies of the same named card.

entries.heading: Includes your Chosen Champion
path: Up to 3 copies of same named card
entries.text: This includes your Chosen Champion. Example: A deck could include Volibear, Furious as its Chosen Champion and still include 2 more copies of Volibear, Furious.

entries.heading: Different names are different cards
path: Up to 3 copies of same named card
entries.text: Cards have different names even if they represent the same character. Example: A deck could include 3 copies of Yasuo, Remorseful and 3 copies of Yasuo, Windrider, because they have different names.

entries.heading: Subject to Domain Identity
entries.text: Subject to Domain Identity.

entries.heading: Signature card limit (3 total) with same Champion tag
path: Signature card limit (3 total) with same Champion tag
entries.text: Your deck may only contain 3 total Signature cards that have the same Champion tag as your Champion Legend.

entries.heading: Sum total of 3 Signature cards regardless of name
path: Signature card limit (3 total) with same Champion tag
Sum total of 3 Signature cards regardless of name
entries.text: Regardless of name, a deck may only contain a sum total of 3 Signature cards.

entries.heading: All Signature cards must match Champion Legend tag
path: Signature card limit (3 total) with same Champion tag
All Signature cards must match Champion Legend tag
entries.text: All of the Signature cards must have the Champion tag that corresponds to the Champion Legend of the deck.

entries.heading: Signature cards are not Champion units
path: Signature card limit (3 total) with same Champion tag
Signature cards are not Champion units
entries.text: Signature cards are not Champion units and cannot be placed in the Champion Zone.

entries.heading: Main Deck is Secret Information
entries.text: During Gameplay, the Main Deck is Secret Information.

entries.heading: Cannot be looked through unless instructed
path: Cannot be looked through unless instructed
entries.text: It cannot be looked through or revealed unless instructed by a card effect.
